author: S Prasad
text:
Flying squads, surveillance teams formed to check violations

A differently abled woman being assisted by a policeman at a polling booth, in Puducherry.- file Photo

The district administration has taken steps to construct of ramps and other facilities at all the 771 polling stations in Puducherry district as per the guidelines formulated by the Election Commission of India.

“We are taking necessary steps to ensure hassle-free voting for differently abled persons in polling stations in Puducherry district including Mahe and Yanam regions. Wheel chairs will also be kept ready at the booths ,” District Election Officer and Collector S. Sundaravadivelu told The Hindu.

As many as 32 flying squads and 14 static surveillance teams have been formed in Puducherry district to check violations of Model Code of Conduct. They will monitor the poll expenses incurred by the parties and candidates round the clock.

The teams will go around the constituencies allotted to them and record the number of vehicles used by the political parties and the candidates. The teams will keep a close vigil on violations and initiate legal action.

Mr. Sundaravadivelu said the first level checking of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) has been completed. The randomisation process of EVMs will be conducted on March 17 in the presence of political parties.

The training session for electoral officers prior to the introduction of the Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail system will be held on March 17.

The VVPAT system will be introduced in Uppalam, Orleanpet and Karaikal South constituencies in the coming elections.

“We are trying to ensure hassle-free voting for differently abled persons”
title: Govt. to pull out all stops to make polling booths disabled-friendly
